metadata.title: CVE-2018-1272 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Spring Framework, versions 5.0 prior to 5.0.5 and versions 4.3 prior to4.3.15 and older unsupported versions, provide client-side support formultipart requests. When Spring MVC or Spring WebFlux server application(server A) receives input from a remote client, and then uses that input tomake a multipart request to another server (server B), it can be exposed toan attack, where an extra multipart is inserted in the content of therequest from server A, causing server B to use the wrong value for a partit expects. This could to lead privilege escalation, for example, if thepart content represents a username or user roles.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1272` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspring-aop-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-beans-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-context-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-context-support-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-core-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-expression-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-instrument-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-jdbc-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-jms-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-messaging-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-orm-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-oxm-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-test-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-transaction-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-web-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-web-portlet-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-web-servlet-java - 4.3.19-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libspring-java package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.19-1').
